pl.bristleback.server.bristle.engine.servlet

Class BristlebackHttpHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.bristleback.server.bristle.engine.servlet.BristlebackHttpHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware, org.springframework.web.HttpRequestHandler

    public class BristlebackHttpHandler
extends Object
implements org.springframework.web.HttpRequestHandler, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware
    Basic Spring Http handler used in all Bristleback Web applications. To make use of this class, application creator has to use Spring Dispatcher Servlet and add it to web.xml descriptor file. Details of how it can be done are presented on the Bristleback wiki page. Bristleback <bb:servlet> tag creates Spring bean of this class and maps it in Spring HandlerMapping implementation. If not provided by application creator, servlet tag creates following mapping:

      <bean id="customMappings" class="org.springframework.web.servlet.handler.SimpleUrlHandlerMapping">
        <property name="mappings">
          <map>
            <entry key="**/*" value-ref="bristlebackHttpHandler"/>
          </map>
        </property>
      </bean>
    Which means that every request within Spring Dispatcher Servlet will be handled by Bristleback Http handler. Application creator can specify custom url handler mappings. To use custom url handler mapping, just set handlerMappings field in servlet tag.

    If Bristleback Http handler is used, only those Websocket Engines that implement ServletServerEngine interface can be used, as their handleRequest() method is used here.

    Created on: 2012-04-25 16:59:49

    Author:
    Wojciech Niemiec
